com.stockticker.persistence

Interface PersistenceConnection

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PersistenceConnectionImpl

    public interface PersistenceConnection

    Defines the public interface for creating and accessing a JDBC database connection.

    Version:
    1.0 3/12/14.
    Author:
    Stuart Connall
    See Also:
    PersistenceConnectionImpl, PersistenceServiceException

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean closeConnection()
      Closes the database connection
      boolean connectionEstablished()
      Determines if the connection has been established.
      Connection getConnection()
      Returns the active JDBC Connection.
      void start()
      Invokes the PersistenceConnection to perform initialization.
      void start(String propertiesFileOverride)
      Invokes the PersistenceConnection to perform initialization and passes an alternate properties file to the initialize routine.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start(String propertiesFileOverride)
           throws PersistenceServiceException
        Invokes the PersistenceConnection to perform initialization and passes an alternate properties file to the initialize routine.
        Parameters:
        propertiesFileOverride - an alternate properties file to use
        Throws:
        PersistenceServiceException - occurs when a failure occurs during PersistenceConnection initialization. Failures can be due to the service not locating the application properties file or a failure creating or connecting to the database.

      • start

        void start()
           throws PersistenceServiceException
        Invokes the PersistenceConnection to perform initialization.
        Throws:
        PersistenceServiceException - occurs when a failure occurs during PersistenceConnection initialization. Failures can be due to the service not locating the application properties file or a failure creating or connecting to the database.

      • getConnection

        Connection getConnection()
        Returns the active JDBC Connection. If the connection is null, it means that the database connection has yet to be established. The PersistenceConnection's start method must be invoked first.
        Returns:
        a JDBC Connection, otherwise null

      • connectionEstablished

        boolean connectionEstablished()
        Determines if the connection has been established.
        Returns:
        true if connection established, false otherwise

      • closeConnection

        boolean closeConnection()
        Closes the database connection
        Returns:
        true if connection successfully closed, false otherwise
